content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully assembled on the map. Repeated attempts to craft and place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) did not yield a valid structure due to inventory shortages and cascading resource‐requirements. Although existing furnaces were identified and used for smelting (an iron-smelting furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper-smelting furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)), none of these operations resulted in the creation of new, agent‐built production structures.

ERROR TIPS
• Incorrect API usage for get_entities:
 – When calling get_entities, use only the supported argument format. Avoid adding unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extra positional arguments.
• Entity placement failures:
 – Before attempting to place an entity (for example, a Lab at (0.5, 2.5)), confirm that the required item is available in the inventory.
• Handling None values in iteration:
 – Validate that functions return a proper iterable (or an empty list) before looping over results to prevent ‘NoneType’ errors.
• Crafting resource shortfalls:
 – Ensure that all recipe dependencies and sub-ingredients (for instance, iron-gear-wheels and copper-cables required for crafting a Lab) are sufficiently available. Monitor resource counts after processing (such as smelting) so that crafting operations are only initiated when prerequisites are met.
